1.verse: O give thanks unto the LORD, for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2.verse: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom he hath redeemed from the hand of the enemy;

3.verse: And gathered them out of the lands, from the east, and from the west, from the north, and from the south.

4.verse: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.

5.verse: Hungry and thirsty, their soul fainted in them.

6.verse: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he delivered them out of their distresses.

7.verse: And he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a city of habitation.

8.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

9.verse: For he satisfieth the longing soul, and filleth the hungry soul with goodness.

10.verse: Such as sit in darkness and in the shadow of death, being bound in affliction and iron;

11.verse: Because they rebelled against the words of God, and contemned the counsel of the most High:

12.verse: Therefore he brought down their heart with labour; they fell down, and there was none to help.

13.verse: Then they cried unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saved them out of their distresses.

14.verse: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death, and brake their bands in sunder.

15.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

16.verse: For he hath broken the gates of brass, and cut the bars of iron in sunder.

17.verse: Fools because of their transgression, and because of their iniquities, are afflicted.

18.verse: Their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near unto the gates of death.

19.verse: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he saveth them out of their distresses.

20.verse: He sent his word, and healed them, and delivered them from their destructions.

21.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

22.verse: And let them sacrifice the sacrifices of thanksgiving, and declare his works with rejoicing.

23.verse: They that go down to the sea in ships, that do business in great waters;

24.verse: These see the works of the LORD, and his wonders in the deep.

25.verse: For he commandeth, and raiseth the stormy wind, which lifteth up the waves thereof.

26.verse: They mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths: their soul is melted because of trouble.

27.verse: They reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are at their wits' end.

28.verse: Then they cry unto the LORD in their trouble, and he bringeth them out of their distresses.

29.verse: He maketh the storm a calm, so that the waves thereof are still.

30.verse: Then are they glad because they be quiet; so he bringeth them unto their desired haven.

31.verse: Oh that men would praise the LORD for his goodness, and for his wonderful works to the children of men!

32.verse: Let them exalt him also in the congregation of the people, and praise him in the assembly of the elders.

33.verse: He turneth rivers into a wilderness, and the watersprings into dry ground;

34.verse: A fruitful land into barrenness, for the wickedness of them that dwell therein.

35.verse: He turneth the wilderness into a standing water, and dry ground into watersprings.

36.verse: And there he maketh the hungry to dwell, that they may prepare a city for habitation;

37.verse: And sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits of increase.

38.verse: He blesseth them also, so that they are multiplied greatly; and suffereth not their cattle to decrease.

39.verse: Again, they are minished and brought low through oppression, affliction, and sorrow.

40.verse: He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in the wilderness, where there is no way.

41.verse: Yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him families like a flock.

42.verse: The righteous shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniquity shall stop her mouth.

43.verse: Whoso is wise, and will observe these things, even they shall understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.
